1.text: I commend to you Phoebe, our sister, who is a servant of the assembly that is at Cenchreae,

2.text: that you receive her in the Lord, in a way worthy of the saints, and that you assist her in whatever matter she may need from you, for she herself also has been a helper of many, and of my own self.

3.text: Greet Prisca and Aquila, my fellow workers in Christ Jesus,

4.text: who for my life, laid down their own necks; to whom not only I give thanks, but also all the assemblies of the Gentiles.

5.text: Greet the assembly that is in their house. Greet Epaenetus, my beloved, who is the first fruits of Achaia to Christ.

6.text: Greet Mary, who labored much for us.

7.text: Greet Andronicus and Junia, my relatives and my fellow prisoners, who are notable among the apostles, who also were in Christ before me.

8.text: Greet Amplias, my beloved in the Lord.

9.text: Greet Urbanus, our fellow worker in Christ, and Stachys, my beloved.

10.text: Greet Apelles, the approved in Christ. Greet those who are of the household of Aristobulus.

11.text: Greet Herodion, my kinsman. Greet them of the household of Narcissus, who are in the Lord.

12.text: Greet Tryphaena and Tryphosa, who labor in the Lord. Greet Persis, the beloved, who labored much in the Lord.

13.text: Greet Rufus, the chosen in the Lord, and his mother and mine.

14.text: Greet Asyncritus, Phlegon, Hermes, Patrobas, Hermas, and the brothers who are with them.

15.text: Greet Philologus and Julia, Nereus and his sister, and Olympas, and all the saints who are with them.

16.text: Greet one another with a holy kiss. The assemblies of Christ greet you.

17.text: Now I beg you, brothers, look out for those who are causing the divisions and occasions of stumbling, contrary to the doctrine which you learned, and turn away from them.

18.text: For those who are such donâ€™t serve our Lord, Jesus Christ, but their own belly; and by their smooth and flattering speech, they deceive the hearts of the innocent.

19.text: For your obedience has become known to all. I rejoice therefore over you. But I desire to have you wise in that which is good, but innocent in that which is evil.

20.text: And the God of peace will quickly crush Satan under your feet. The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you.

21.text: Timothy, my fellow worker, greets you, as do Lucius, Jason, and Sosipater, my relatives.

22.text: I, Tertius, who write the letter, greet you in the Lord.

23.text: Gaius, my host and host of the whole assembly, greets you. Erastus, the treasurer of the city, greets you, as does Quartus, the brother.

24.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with you all! Amen.
